title: Patriots will ‘stick to the same plan’ this week with Zak Kuhr calling plays as Terrell Williams recovers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots Williams will be more involved this week, but the defensive play-calling set up will be the same as last week, according to Mike Vrabel.

Terrell Williams Danielle Parhizkaran/The Boston Globe FOXBOROUGH — The Patriots are sticking with inside linebackers coach Zak Kuhr as their defensive playcaller for the second-straight week as defensive coordinator Terrell Williams continues to recover from an unforeseen health issue, coach Mike Vrabel said Monday.
The home contest against Pittsburgh will be the second straight-game Williams has missed.

title: Stefon Diggs sidesteps question about Cardi B’s baby announcement
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots "Oh, my personal life?
I told you, I don't talk too much about it," Diggs said with a smile.
"I heard about it.

title: Trump administration lawsuit claims R.I. is discriminating against white teachers
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Education The DOJ alleges that a student loan forgiveness program aimed at educators of color amounts to “blatant race discrimination.

title: More than 1,000 MCAS essays scored incorrectly due to AI mishap
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Education The temporary technical issue impacted an average of one or two students' scores in each of the 145 affected districts.
A Waltham High School student writes a practice MCAS essay in 2005.
Tom Landers/The Boston Globe Approximately 1,400 MCAS essays were scored incorrectly due to an AI-grading mishap, according to the state Department of Elementary and Secondary Education.

title: Machine Gun Kelly speaks about haters to the students at Harvard Business School
author: Megan Johnson
bullets: Celebs "The more silent people are probably the ones that I need to care more about.
" MGK, formerly known as Machine Gun Kelly, had a few words of advice for the students of Harvard Business School earlier this week.

The musician, who has dipped his toes into everything from rap to pop to punk, hit the hallowed halls of Harvard University in Boston’s Allston neighborhood to serve as a guest speaker at the Business School’s Entertainment and Media Club, where he spoke candidly about how he deals with his haters.

title: Christian Gonzalez returns to Patriots practice

title: 5 early surprises from the Patriots this season
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots Two weeks in, the Patriots have produced plenty of surprises.
